content.description:
The path of least resistance in front of the big tree in front of Moscow Wall.

The crux of the route is the first ten feet. Then it eases up but the crux is mostly mental then after. Brittle, chossy rock makes for easy but mental climbing. No dynamic moves here!
content.protection: Protection is there but subtle. Scope it from the ground and size up the gear from there. Watch out for questionable rock.
content.location: Center of the wall. In front of the big tree. Hiding behind the tree is recommended to avoid falling rock.

content.description:
Locate the tree in the center of the Moscow Wall. Start on the right facing crack and follow the protection up, diagonal and then connect on to the small direct crack system. Mellow climbing and decent rock (still needs traffic).

The line resembles a sickle.
content.protection: Great options for protection but you must be familiar with detecting questionable rock. Natural Anchor - big A$$ boulder.
content.location:
Cliff Left of Rawlhide Wall

Below Plane Above Your Head Wall
